senses.sense_definition: A person who tells a story or gives an account of events.

examples.text: The <w>relator</w> of the ancient legend captivated the audience with his voice.
She acted as the primary <w>relator</w> of the events that took place that night.

senses.sense_definition: A private party who reports a violation of law to the government and allows a lawsuit to be filed on their behalf.

examples.text: The court ruled that the <w>relator</w> was entitled to a portion of the recovered funds.
A <w>relator</w> filed the complaint under the False Claims Act.

senses.sense_definition: An expression in group theory that defines the identity element and establishes relations between generators.

examples.text: The student identified the <w>relator</w> required to solve the group presentation problem.
In this mathematical structure, every <w>relator</w> corresponds to a specific loop.

senses.sense_definition: One who establishes a connection or link between different things.

examples.text: He served as a <w>relator</w> between the two opposing theories.
The software acts as a <w>relator</w> for the disparate data sets.
